quack.heading: Document word lists
quack.text: When writing, especially when writing technical documentation, we frequently use words and terms that are unknown to the dictionary of our chosen language. We can "Add" such words so that they are ignored by the spell checker, but adding them to the user's personal dictionary on the local system is pointless: as soon as they share the document with anyone else, the words will be marked misspelled again.
Thus when marking a word as not a mistake, we add that word to a document word list. The format is one word per line, as follows:
quack.code: # Document word list blockquote endnote inlines NormalSegment stylesheet
quack.text: and so on. The file is optional, but if it has been created it is sorted alphabetically, and placed in a file with the same basename as the manuscript and with a .dic extension; again in the example of this document, the word list is ParchmentFileFormat.dic and should be added to version control.
